instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted
threads.message:
Hi,

This is not a liquid damaged board but <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> both blown and no power at all. I replaced both chips and now I get 20v in <SIGNAL>SUBC_VBUS</SIGNAL> , 13v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> ,3.3v <SIGNAL>PP3V3_GH3</SIGNAL>.

Then <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>,<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>P5VP3V3_VREF</SIGNAL> pulisng and not stable. then became 0V  on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> in shorted and 0v on diod mode.

I injected 3.3v to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and heating component are <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> and PCH. I replaced the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> and still  the short is there.

Any adivce will be greatly appriciated.

Regards

Don

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted
threads.message: I think you know what's dead here unfortunately...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted
threads.message: If now only PCH/CPU heats up, can't doubt anymore...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted
threads.message: I doubt about a dead PCH.  but as more than 10 line of <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5G</SIGNAL> goes straight tothe PCH I'm doubting is it normail to get PCH hot when I inject 3.3v on line line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted
threads.message:
Hi Duke,

really appriciate you advice/opinion in regards this. thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted
threads.message:
If PCH heats when inhect into one of its 3V3 lines, this very clear; dead PCH...
A good PCH cannot sink more than some tens, or hundreds mA, depending where the voltage is injected.
That cannot make it hot at all.
